Candidates for Baltimore mayor have easily spent more money than in previous election cycles. The top seven Democrats running for mayor combined to spend more than $5.6 million as of April 15, the most recent filing deadline for campaign finance reports. Early voting began April 14.

Here’s a look at how the top five candidates’ vote totals compared to the amount they reported spending during the campaign.

Votes

Dollars spent

Sheila Dixon

500,000 votes

$0.9m

per vote

Catherine Pugh

500,000 votes

$1.1m

$62
per vote

500,000 votes

$0.3m

$62
per vote

David Warnock

500,000 votes

$2.4m

$62
per vote

Elizabeth Embry

500,000 votes

$0.4m

$62
per vote

* Includes the top five mayoral candidates with most votes

** Campaign finance numbers do not include PAC funds
